description: Smallest number whose n-th power is a sum of distinct smaller n-th powers.
links: Various authors, How each power is decomposed
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Diophantine Equation.
example: 3^1 = 2^1 + 1^1. For more examples, see the link.
author: Richard Schroeppel
extensions: n = 8 through 10 terms found by _David W. Wilson_
a(14) and a(15) from Manol Iliev, Apr 28 2011
